synopsis: Piena, the largest nation on the continent, is having its annual ritual dance festival. The semi-finalists and winner are allowed to compete against the previous champion, Princess Nashtania. One of the competitors is a daring boy, Adret Ma.

Adlet and the princess head for the Land where Demons Howl, past Gwenbyer, the Kingdom of Iron Hills. Ten days after they leave Piena, they meet villagers escaping from the fiends. Adlet suspects a trap, but challenges the fiends anyway!

The heroes, or most of them, meet up. Many of them want to kill Flamie, but she barely survives. Meanwhile, the king of Gwenbyer has come up with a plot to trap most of the monsters on the continent and make the way clear for the heroes.

The Braves head for the barrier temple, but they encounter a massive army of fiends along the way. To seal the fiends in, they'll have to fight their way past. And to make matters worse, scores of flying fiends are bombing the temple!

The Six Braves have gathered, but the phantasmal barrier has been activated. With only one means of deactivating the barrier, the Braves must figure out which of them is the fake Brave. Meanwhile, Flamie reveals a surprising secret.

With the others suspicious of him, Adlet must convince them that he is not a traitor. But to do that, he must discover how the temple was breached and the barrier activated. With the others have consolidated their suspicion of him, what will he do?

Adlet tells Flamie the story how his master trained him to be the strongest man in the world. Flamie leaves him, but not before she gives him a gunpowder token, which he can use once to  make Flamie aware of his location. The other Braves decide to split up into pairs to try and find Adlet. Hans and Chamot stay behind at the Temple.

Hans and Adlet engage in a battle to the death, which ultimately proves neither of them can be the Seventh Brave. They both return to the temple where they meet Chamot who unleashes het Saintly abilities to try to kill them both, however Hans and Adlet are not planning to go down that easily

Adler and Hans take out Chamot in a direct Assault. Adlet uses the gunpowder token to summon Flamie to tell her his theory about the way the seventh activated the barrier, but Flamie proves him wrong. Meanwhile at the temple Hans and Chamot are convinced by Maura that Adlet has fooled them unto thinking he is not the Seventh...

While Adlet is trying to convince Flamie he is telling the truth about the Seventh Brave, Maura uses her Saint of the Mountains powers and makes her move. She tells the other braves Adlet has left Hans near death at the ruins. Hans, whom is fine, is still at the ruins and guarded by Chamot. In a direct confrontation between Flamie and Maura, Flamie makes a unexpected descision. At that point the Saint of Blades, whom feels betrayed and hurt by Adlet, enters the fight with only one goal...

With Adlet mortally wounded by the attacks of the Saint of Blades and Goldov, he gets one more chance to prove to all the Braves who is the Seventh. With Flamie at his side, he explains how the Seventh used the Saint of the Sun and a staged "fiend" battle field to hide the tracks. Even Maura is convinced that the strongest man in the world is telling the truth, but then who is the Seventh Brave ?

The Seventh Brave is finally revealed and tries to convince the other Braves to accept its plan to unite the world of Fiends and Humans with a terrible costs on lives on he human side. The Braves try to deal with the imposter but it escapes, resulting in the deactivation of the barrier of mists. With allied troops arriving at the temple the Braves decide to move on. But not before Rolonia, the Saint of Blood, joins them as the new Seventh. With the activated barrier of mist behind them the path to their home lands is blocked, from this point on the roads leads straight to the Demon God lands.  Their mission and purpose is clear : destroy the Demon God and along the way find out the mystery of the now Eight Braves once and for all.
